title: Azir isn't the first Mage/Marksman in League, even if he's the first to be classified as one.
body:
{{champion:4}} is a Marksman as well as a Mage. 

Riot, please classify Twisted Fate to have his secondary role be a Marksman instead of N/A. There is no question about it, he has been doing that secondary role for far longer than Azir, I am pretty sure he's the first Mage/Marksman in League. 

He has been viable as ADC before as well. 

Upvote to show Rito.

TF has both his W and his E, giving him both an on-hit booster and a straight-up steroid.  It is less of the fact that they rely on their autoattack and more that they CAN rely on because they have the tools to make it better.

I still think we should draw a distinction between someone who can go mage OR marksman, and someone who is a mage/marksman.  TF can build either, but if he builds mage, he isn't a marksman, and if he builds as a marksman, he isn't a mage.  Azir does both simultaneously, and I would say shares that classification with only Teemo and Kayle.

TF doesn't have AD scalings. The only thing that would make him a marksman is bonus attack speed. Yes, W technically scales with AD, but it's an auto attack after all. So it doesn't use AD any more than any other mage's auto attacks.

It's an ability therefore he has AD scalings. 
That's like saying Nasus's isn't an ability because he has to Autoattack to use it. 
Or Wukong's Q or Garen Q.

First of all, those deal bonus physical damage based on your AD (except for Nasus - so he doesn't really have AD scalings as well, nor does he build AD), not just the standard autoattack damage. Secondly, they reset your autoattack timer. So the more AD you have, the more they increase your dps. That's not the case for TF - whether he has 100 or 1000 AD, his W only increases his dps by the flat amount of the bonus spell damage (and % of AP if he has any).
For example: You autattack 5 times in a given time, so you deal damage equal to your 500% AD.
But then you throw in an additional ability in there. As Wukong, you use your Q. First, that one attack deals 110% AD, but also it resets your aa, so let's say you make 6 autoattacks in the same time instead of 5. That's 610% AD + the flat bonus damage from Q. Garen deals 640%, Nasus 600%. Compare that to 500% AD from only autoattacks.
Now, if TF casts his W, it doesn't reset his aa timer, so he still has only 5 attacks, and so he deals 500% AD. Same as if he didn't use any ability at all, except it gives him flat bonus damage. Therefore, his W doesn't actually scale with AD.

In other words, if you removed all flat bonus damage from abilities, Twisted Fate's W wouldn't increase his dps at all (unless he built AP), whereas Garen's W and Wukong's Q would.
